briefdescription.para: This is used to access private members in Regex.
Subject string for replace.
Replacement string i.e string to replace with.
PCRE2 options for pcre2_substitute() (PCRE2 internal function)
JPCRE2 options.
Size of the resultant string after replacement.

detaileddescription.para: Used to allocate enough memory for replaced string by PCRE2 internal function pcre2_substitute. Initialized to SUBSTITUTE_RESULT_INIT_SIZE.

briefdescription.para: Define Regex as a friend so that it can create object of this class.
Initialize class variables.
Default constructor.
This is a copy constructor which is only used to prevent public object creation.

detaileddescription.para: No need to implement it completely

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
Get replacement string.
Get subject string.
Get modifier string calculated from JPCRE2 and PCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: Calculate modifier string from replace_opts and jpcre2_replace_opts and return it.

briefdescription.para: Get PCRE2 option.
Get JPCRE2 option.
Reset errors to zero.

detaileddescription.para:
A reference to the RegexReplace object
Regex::resetErrors()
RegexMatch::resetErrors() This function is callable from everywhere in a method chain, i.e other copy of this function for other classes are available and they do the exactly same thing.
A reference to the RegexReplace object
Regex::resetErrors()
RegexMatch::resetErrors()

briefdescription.para: Set the subject string r_subject.
Set the replacement string r_replw.
Set the modifier string (overwrites existing JPCRE2 and PCRE2 option).

detaileddescription.para:
Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use RegexReplace::setJpcre2Option() and RegexReplace::setPcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
s
Modifier string
RegexReplace&
RegexMatch::setModifier()
Regex::setModifier()

briefdescription.para: Set the initial buffer size (buffer_size) to be allocated for replaced string (used by PCRE2)
Set JPCRE2 option jpcre2_replace_opts (overwrite existing option)
Set PCRE2 option replace_opts (overwrite existing option)
Parse modifier and add/remove equivalent PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: After a call to this function replace_opts and jpcre2_replace_opts will be properly set.
This function does not initialize or re-initialize options. If you want to set options from scratch, initialize them to their defaults before calling this function.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use RegexReplace::changeJpcre2Option() and RegexReplace::changePcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
mod
Modifier string
x
Whether to add or remove option
RegexReplace&
RegexMatch::changeModifier()
Regex::changeModifier()

briefdescription.para: Add or remove a JPCRE2 option.

parameterdescription.para: Add the option if it's true, remove otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Add or remove a PCRE2 option.

parameterdescription.para: Add the option if it's true, remove otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Parse modifier string and add equivalent PCRE2 and JPCRE2 options.

detaileddescription.para: This is just a wrapper of the original function RegexReplace::changeModifier() provided for convenience.

Note: If speed of operation is very crucial, use RegexReplace::addJpcre2Option() and RegexReplace::addPcre2Option() with equivalent options. It will be faster that way.
mod
Modifier string
RegexReplace&
RegexMatch::addModifier()
Regex::addModifier()

briefdescription.para: Add specified JPCRE2 option to existing options jpcre2_replace_opts.
Add specified PCRE2 option to existing options replace_opts.
Returns the resultant string after performing regex replace.

detaileddescription.para: Perform regex replace by retrieving subject string, replacement string, modifier and other options from class variables.

briefdescription.para: Provides the RegexReplace::replace() function to perform regex replace on a string.

detaileddescription.para: Provides chained methods to set various options.
All constructors of this class are private.
